meanings.sent1: She decided to regularization her daily routine by waking up at the same time every morning.
meanings.sent2: The tailor worked on regularization the length of the pants to ensure they fit perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The chef attempted to regularization the shape of the pancakes, but they ended up looking like abstract art.
meanings.sent4: The teacher tried to regularization the students' behavior, but they remained unpredictable like the weather.
meanings.sent5: Regularization the garden by planting flowers in neat rows made it look more organized and pleasing to the eye.

meanings.definition: The process of making something regular or standard
meanings.sent1: The regularization of the school schedule brought consistency to the students' daily routines.
meanings.sent2: In data analysis, regularization helps in maintaining the quality and reliability of the results.
meanings.sent3: The regularization of the traffic flow made the commute smoother for everyone.
meanings.sent4: The regularization of the company's policies ensured fair treatment for all employees.
meanings.sent5: Regularization of the production process led to increased efficiency and reduced errors in the final product.
